sec.title: Prayers of Approach, Confession and Forgiveness
Call to prayer

disp-quote.p: Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the desert
so the Son of Man must be lifted up
that everyone who believes in him may have eternal life

sec.p: Almighty God
on a mountain top Peter, James and John
looked upon the majesty of Christ Jesus
and from a cloud
heard a voice declaring him to be Your Son
Though we do not live on mountain tops
grant that we too may glimpse his glory
In this hour of worship
we turn from the duties and activities of life
to look again to the One
whose death upon the cross has raised us up
and opened to us the gate of eternal life.
Let sight give way to insight
that the paths of earth
might become for us the road to heaven
through the same Jesus Christ our Lord
Merciful Father
in Christ Jesus
You have called us love our enemy
to walk a second mile
and to do good to those who hate us
You have shown us what true compassion is like
and asked us to care for our neighbour
And by our Lord’s death and rising again
You have promised that the way of love
cannot be defeated by sin or death
What little faith we have
what poor disciples we are
for in comparison to him
our lives are shallow
we lack humility
and our actions betray a want of true goodness and care
Forgive us those things
of which our conscience is afraid
and grant us those good things
which we are not worthy to ask
save through the love of him who is our Saviour.
May the God of love and mercy forgive you and set you free from all your sin
Jesus said, Arise, go in peace, your faith has made you whole
God of light and truth
open our eyes to the glory of Your presence
in the world around us
and in the face of Jesus Christ Your Son
that we may grow into his likeness
to the glory of him who is our Saviour and Lord
and who taught us to pray together
our Father……….

sec.title: Prayers of Thanksgiving and Intercession
sec.p: Far beyond the sight of our eyes
far beyond the reach of our minds
You live in glory
immortal, invisible
Almighty and eternal God
Yet we would thank You
that in Your mercy You have allowed us a fleeting glimpse of Your glory
on a hillside or in a garden we have sensed the nearness of Your presence
while listening to music our souls have been lifted to new heights
in precious moments of worship and of prayer
You have spoken to us Your Word of truth
and in the love of our family and friends
we have known an eternal love
And by Your grace in all of these things
hope has been transformed
love renewed
our faith restored
and You have sent us back out into the world
comforted, strengthened and inspired to follow in the way of Christ
Grant to us and to all Christ’s Church
the bright lamp of faith
and when the road is steep and the way hard
let us not stray from the path of truth and love
in Christ Jesus our Lord
Living and loving God
on a mountainside our Lord was transfigured
his face radiant like the sun
so we pray for all who know darkness in their lives
the darkness of warfare
the darkness of hunger and disease
the darkness of injustice and oppression
the darkness of violence and abuse
the darkness of loneliness
May the light of Your love transform such suffering
and through the prayers and actions of Your people
let those in need find shelter, hope and peace
When Jesus returned from the mountain
people brought to him their sick that he might touch them
we pray for all who suffer illness or distress in body, mind or spirit
Bless all who share with Christ a healing ministry
research scientists, doctors, surgeons, nurses
the many people involved in the health services
Use their sympathy and skill to bring about
the relief of suffering and the overcoming of disease
God of time and eternity
on a mountain top Peter, James and John
looked upon the majesty of Christ Jesus
and from a cloud
heard a voice declaring him to be Your Son
Though we do not live on mountain tops
grant that we too may glimpse his glory
In the routine of our daily life
may there be for us moments
when sight gives way to insight
and the paths of earth
become the road to heaven
through the same Jesus Christ our Lord
to whom with the Father and the Holy Spirit
one God, be all glory and praise
now and for evermore. Amen

sec.title: Prayers of Approach, Confession and Forgiveness
Call to prayer

disp-quote.p: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathise with our
weakness but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we

sec.p: With the birth of Jesus
Your Word became flesh
Coming to live among us
Your love was revealed
And then at Easter as he died and rose again
You set us free from the power of evil and death
Promising us life that is full and hope that is eternal
Good and loving God
gathered now as the people of Christ’s church
we praise You for a great high priest,
who shared our humanity
understands our weakness
and prays for our well being
Source of life and truth
he came to serve, not to be served
Son of Mary and Son of God
when in a garden he felt abandoned and alone
he displayed true courage and love
and on Calvary’s cross
he trusted himself into Your keeping
As the season of Lent begins
may Your Holy Spirit lead us
to a deeper awareness of Your presence and promise
a firmer grasp of Your truth and love
and a renewed commitment to following in the way of the cross.
Grant us ears to hear
eyes to see
and a heart to respond to all You have given
and all You continue to promise
in Jesus Christ our Lord
God of grace and mercy
we turn again to You
for today we recall that fasting in the wilderness for forty days and nights
Jesus was tempted to turn stone into bread
Forgive us if instead of helping others
we have used our gifts and powers to satisfy our own needs
We recall Jesus was tempted to throw himself from the temple
Forgive us if instead of nobler demands upon our time and talent
we have sought popularity and the praise of others
And we recall that Jesus was tempted to bow down and worship the devil
Forgive us if having offered the worship of our lips
we have not also offered the worship of our lives
Lead us to an honest appraisal
of what is wrong in our lives and in our world
the things that must be changed
and what we must do to bring that change about.
Grant us a new beginning
and send us out into the world to share with others
the renewed life and hope You have given us in Christ our Lord
May the God of love and mercy forgive you and set you free from all your sin
Jesus said, Arise, go in peace your faith has made you whole
Almighty God
whose Son fasted forty days in the wilderness
and was tempted as we are but did not sin,
give us grace to direct our lives
in obedience to Your Spirit
that in the doing of Your will
we may know Your power to save
through Jesus Christ our Lord
in whose words we further pray
Our Father….

sec.title: Prayers of Thanksgiving and Intercession (including sung response)

bold.italic: CHOIR: Ubi caritas et amor (CH 4 no 801)

sec.p: God of all seasons
in Your pattern of life there is
a time for silence and a time for speech
a time for mourning and a time for dancing
a time to be born and a time to die
Trusting that every time and experience of life is embraced in Your providence
we turn again to You
for the refreshment and renewal of our lives
We thank You for this season of Lent
with its invitation to pause and take stock
to reflect upon the things of life that really matter
to reflect upon the people and relationships of life that really matter
to reflect upon the things of faith that really matter
Help us put this time to good use
to listen attentively for the still small whisper of Your voice
and to discern the pattern of Your presence and purpose in our lives
Speak to us in the depth of our hearts
and send us out into the world
with fresh courage and a greater resolve
to bear witness to the goodness and love
You have shown us in Jesus Christ our Lord.
God of justice and peace
for forty days and nights
Jesus fasted in the wilderness
Hear our prayer for the suffering places of the world
where people hunger for food and clean water
the harrowing places where people suffer oppression and discrimination
the bleak places of disease and poverty where people face a daily struggle to live
the war torn places where people live in fear and hope is scarce
May the Lord of the wilderness be their strength and their hope
God of courage and compassion
during his forty days and nights in the wilderness Jesus was tested
hear our prayer for people facing hard and testing times
people left homeless or made redundant
those who have been victims of crime or domestic violence
those who have grown old and frail and their families who worry and care for them
those whose lives and families have been devastated by illness or accident
all who are lonely or who struggle with a daily burden of disability
those who draw near to death and all who mourn a loved one’s passing
May the Lord of the wilderness be their strength and hope
God of grace and mercy
during his time in the desert Jesus found the strength to resist temptation
hear our prayer for those who are not so strong
people caught up in criminal activity or imprisoned
those who drink too much or who have placed themselves in debt
people addicted to gambling
youngsters wasting their lives on drugs
all using their gifts and opportunities in the wrong way
May the Lord of the wilderness grant each of us the opportunity to turn from what is wrong
and to seek again that which is good and fulfilling
God of time and eternity
in the end Jesus remained obedient telling Satan to get behind him
In offering You our prayers we pray for an end to all that frustrates Your purpose
and ask for ourselves strength to stand against all that is evil
courage to seek the justice You demand of us
and faith to live and work each day for the coming of Your kingdom
through Jesus Christ our Lord
to whom with the Father and the Holy Spirit
one God
be all glory and praise
now and for evermore.
Amen
